column5: Hey all! Just wanted to say hi and a thanks for letting me join this great online community. Looks like there are a bunch of great people here and look forward to getting to know one another.  Just thought I'd share a PB smallie from this passed weekend. Spent most of Saturday and Sunday walking the Maitland throwing spinners upstream and "jigging" gulp minnows down. Had quite a few smallie's in the 8-12" range a few small (6") bows and then fishing off a beaver hut hammered this 17" smallie (again, a personal best) all while using my ultralight gear! Great fight and wrapped itself around a bunch of the branches of the hut...but managed to eventually land it! I was ecstatic! lol  Anyways, here's the pics!       Thanks for looking!
Let me be the first to say WELCOME and nice fish!!!   vance
Welcome, nice smallie. I think you will like it here...we like pic's!
Welcome to the board!  Wroxeter, you must have the Maitland flowing through your back yard
Welcome aboard.
Welcome and nie bass!
I was raised in Wingham, and fished the maitland every day in the summer time as a child.  My PB smallie is from the Maitland too  .  Right at the dam by Wescast..  Welcome eh!
Welcome to the looney bin SholtC. That's a nice smallie for the Maitland. If I see too many more I might just have to head up there.

Thanks for all the warm welcomes...as I grow a little more comfortable, I'll be sure to post more often...hopefully with pics John;) After reading through thread after thread, noticing all the great people...I can't imagine me not liking my stay! Thanks again.  As for living in Wroxeter...yep...the mighty (muddy as the damn has been out all summer for repairs(which STILL haven't started)) Maitland is 2 blocks from home. I love being able to walk down to the damn and fish out a smallie or two, minutes from the house. Also nice when the trout start to run in the spring...the whole area is a hotbed for 'em.  F-is-H it's funny you mention the dam by Westcast, I was just eying it up on Sunday morning when I was through Wingham...thinking about walking that stretch from the dam out to the highway and see what I can turn up.
Welcome aboard, nice smallie  Joey
Welcome to the board, and nice fish. Must have been a blast on the ultra light.
Welcome! Fun bunch here.
Welcome aboard...nice smallie for sure. Thanks for the pic.
Welcome aboard,nice smallie btw
Welcome to the OFC Community. Might I say I love the colors on the smallie!! What a beauty.
Throw a canoe in at the golf coarse, and fish down river into Wingham / Lowertown.  All sorts a fun!
Welcome aboard!!
welcome to the board !!! nice smallies. you're gonna love it here. the most knowledgeable gang of anglers you'll ever meet.  tight lines paul
Welcome to the board.  You'll not find a better buch of guys and gals.
Welcome!   Gorgeous smallie!   Look forward to hearing more from you.
welcome aboard ...great way to introduce yourself ...complete with pics... Good on ya

Thanks again for all the warm welcomes!  A great indication of the "crew" here and I look forward to spending more time here.  F-is-H - thanks for the heads up...think I might hit that run on Sunday if we don't play ball too late. I'll be sure to post pics if I do!
Welcome to OFC SholtC Greatest site on the planet.... I'm sure you'll like it in here and congrats on your PB.... real beauty Thanks for sharing Leechman
Welcome to the boards sir!  That's a nice smallie from those gin clear waters up there.  Thanks for sharing and looking forward to seeing more in the future.  Cheers, Ryan
